component.text: Verifying a IPv6 Default Route on R1 and R3

component.feedback: ***You must enter the exact and full command.***
component.existingcommands: Display the IPv6 OSPF routing table on R1 to view the default route propagated from R2.

command.deviceresponse:
IPv6 Routing Table - default - 9 entries
Codes: C - Connected, L - Local, S - Static, U - Per-user Static route
B - BGP, R - RIP, H - NHRP, I1 - ISIS L1
I2 - ISIS L2, IA - ISIS interarea, IS - ISIS summary, D - EIGRP
EX - EIGRP external, ND - ND Default, NDp - ND Prefix, DCE - Destination
NDr - Redirect, O - OSPF Intra, OI - OSPF Inter, OE1 - OSPF ext 1
OE2 - OSPF ext 2, ON1 - OSPF NSSA ext 1, ON2 - OSPF NSSA ext 2
OE2 ::/0 [110/1], tag 10
via FE80::2, Serial0/0/0
O 2001:DB8:CAFE:2::/64 [110/648]
via FE80::2, Serial0/0/0
O 2001:DB8:CAFE:3::/64 [110/648]
via FE80::2, Serial0/0/0
O 2001:DB8:CAFE:A002::/64 [110/1294]
via FE80::2, Serial0/0/0
R1#
command.instruction: You are now logged into R3. Display the IPv6 OSPF routing table on R3 to view the default route propagated from R2.

command.deviceresponse:
IPv6 Routing Table - default - 9 entries
Codes: C - Connected, L - Local, S - Static, U - Per-user Static route
B - BGP, R - RIP, H - NHRP, I1 - ISIS L1
I2 - ISIS L2, IA - ISIS interarea, IS - ISIS summary, D - EIGRP
EX - EIGRP external, ND - ND Default, NDp - ND Prefix, DCE - Destination
NDr - Redirect, O - OSPF Intra, OI - OSPF Inter, OE1 - OSPF ext 1
OE2 - OSPF ext 2, ON1 - OSPF NSSA ext 1, ON2 - OSPF NSSA ext 2
OE2 ::/0 [110/1], tag 10
via FE80::2, GigabitEthernet0/0
O 2001:DB8:CAFE:1::/64 [110/649]
via FE80::2, GigabitEthernet0/0
O 2001:DB8:CAFE:2::/64 [110/1]
via GigabitEthernet0/0, directly connected
O 2001:DB8:CAFE:A001::/64 [110/648]
via FE80::2, GigabitEthernet0/0
R3#
command.instruction: You successfully verified the IPv6 default routes propagated from R2 to R1 and R3.
